thread.title: Arrests made as anti-Muslim march erupts into violent clash with anti-fascists
thread.title_full: Arrests made as anti-Muslim march erupts into violent clash with anti-fascists

title: Arrests made as anti-Muslim march erupts into violent clash with anti-fascists
text:
SWNS/LONDON NEWS VIOLENT: 
Over 150 Britain First supporters – including the far-right group's leader Paul Golding and his deputy Jayda Fransen – yelled anti-Muslim slogans as they marched through Telford, Shrops on Saturday. 
One BF supporter was spotted wearing a bizarre Donald Trump mask as marchers waved Union Jack flags and sang Rule Britannia. 
But the rally turned violent after counter-protesters from the United Against Fascism group lashed out at Britain First members. 
SWNS CASUALTIES: A woman was injured after a missile was hurled at her “ Disorder broke out before and during the march which saw three arrests take place” Superintendent Tom Harding 
The BF group claimed they were marching to expose “Muslim grooming gangs” which they alleged have been covered up by authorities. 
While UAF supporters descended on the march waving signs saying "No to Nazis" and "Refugees welcome here". 
West Mercia Police confirmed three men from the counter protest had been arrested. 
A 27-year-old man from Gloucester was arrested on suspicion of affray after a woman in her 50s was injured by a missile. 
The force also confirmed a 29 year-old man from Selly Oak, Birmingham, and a a 64-year-old man from Telford were also arrested. 
LONDON NEWS CROWDS: Britain First supporters waved flags and chanted anti-Muslim slogans 
Superintendent Tom Harding said: "We have been engaging with both organisers of the demonstrations to ensure the event was safe for those taking part and the local community. 
"We planned a proportionate policing response to ensure a peaceful event with minimal disruption. 
"For the vast majority of those involved this was the case. 
"However disorder broke out before and during the march which saw three arrests take place. 
LONDON NEWS PROTEST: Britain First supporters marching through Telford Anti-facist anarchists RIOT at Berkeley University Thursday, 2nd February 2017 Anti-facist anarchists looted shops, smashed windows and daubed anti-Trump graffiti at a protest at Berkeley University where far right internet troll, Milo Yiannopoulos, was scheduled to give a speech. 1 / 16 EPA A rioter paints an anarchy symbol on a Wells Fargo bank branch. 
"This was a very highly emotive and sensitive situation and public safety - for those involved in the event and others caught up in it - must always remain our priority in such incidents. 
"We will continue to engage with the community over any concerns and work with our partners to address any issues." Related articles
